symbols.name: sap.fe.templates
symbols.description: Library providing the official templates supported by SAP Fiori elements.
symbols.title: namespace sap.fe.templates

nodes.name: sap.fe.templates.ListReport.ExtensionAPI
nodes.description:
Extension API for list reports in SAP Fiori elements for OData V4.
To correctly integrate your app extension coding with SAP Fiori elements, use only the extensionAPI of SAP Fiori elements.

nodes.name: sap.fe.templates.ListReport.ListReportController
nodes.description: Controller class for the list report page, used inside an SAP Fiori elements application.

nodes.name: sap.fe.templates.ObjectPage.ExtensionAPI
nodes.description:
Extension API for object pages on SAP Fiori elements for OData V4.
To correctly integrate your app extension coding with SAP Fiori elements, use only the extensionAPI of SAP Fiori elements.

symbols.name: sap.fe.templates.ListReport.ExtensionAPI
symbols.description:
Extension API for list reports in SAP Fiori elements for OData V4.
To correctly integrate your app extension coding with SAP Fiori elements, use only the extensionAPI of SAP Fiori elements. Don't access or manipulate controls, properties, models, or other internal objects created by the SAP Fiori elements framework.

methods.name: createFiltersFromFilterConditions

returnValue.description: Object containing the converted FilterBar filters or undefined.

parameters.name: mFilterConditions
parameters.description: Map containing the filter conditions of the FilterBar.

methods.description: This method converts the filter conditions to filters.

methods.name: getFilters

returnValue.description: An array of active filters and the search expression or undefined.

methods.description: Provides all the model filters from the filter bar that are currently active along with the search expression.

methods.name: getSelectedContexts
methods.description: Gets the list entries currently selected for the displayed control.

methods.name: refresh

returnValue.description: Resolved once the data is refreshed or rejected if the request failed

methods.description: Refreshes the List Report. This method currently only supports triggering the search (by clicking on the GO button) in the List Report Filter Bar. It can be used to request the initial load or to refresh the currently shown data based on the filters entered by the user. Please note: The Promise is resolved once the search is triggered and not once the data is returned.

methods.name: refreshTabsCount

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: The list of the keys identifying the views defined in the manifest for which the views' count will be refreshed. If not provided, all the views' count will be refreshed

methods.description: Refreshes the count of the views in the MultiMode control.

methods.name: setCustomMessage

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Custom message along with the message type to be set on the table.

parameters.name: tabKey
parameters.description: The tabKey identifying the table where the custom message is displayed. If tabKey is empty, the message is displayed in all tabs . If tabKey = ['1','2'], the message is displayed in tabs 1 and 2 only

parameters.name: onClose
parameters.description: A function that is called when the user closes the message bar.

methods.description: Provide an option for showing a custom message in the message strip above the list report table.

methods.name: setFilterValues

parameters.name: sConditionPath
parameters.description: The path to the property as a condition path

parameters.name: sOperator
parameters.description: The operator to be used (optional) - if not set, the default operator (EQ) will be used

methods.description: Set the filter values for the given property in the filter bar. The filter values can be either a single value or an array of values. Each filter value must be represented as a primitive value.

methods.name: setSelectedTab
methods.description: Provides an option for the selection of a specific tab programamatically.

methods.name: setTabContentToBeRefreshedOnNextOpening

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: The list of the keys identifying the views defined in the manifest for which the views' content will be refreshed. If not provided, all the views' content will be refreshed

methods.description: Refreshes the content of the underlying views upon the next opening. Note: The content of the selected view, if part of the provided keys, will be refreshed immediately.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.templates.ListReport.ExtensionAPI

symbols.name: sap.fe.templates.ListReport.ListReportController
symbols.description: Controller class for the list report page, used inside an SAP Fiori elements application.

methods.name: getExtensionAPI
methods.description: Get the extension API for the current page.

methods.name: onAfterClear
methods.description: Method called when the 'Clear' button on the FilterBar is pressed.

methods.name: onPendingFilters
methods.description: Method called when a filter or search value has been changed in the FilterBar, but has not been validated yet by the end user (with the 'Go' or 'Search' button). Typically, the content of the current tab is greyed out until the filters are validated. This method can be overwritten by the controller extension in case of customization.

methods.name: onViewNeedsRefresh

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description:
Map containing the filter conditions of the FilterBar, the currentTabID and the view refresh cause (tabChanged, search or forcedRefresh). The map looks like this: 

{
filterConditions: {
Country: [
{
operator: "EQ"
validated: "NotValidated"
values: ["Germany", ...]
},
...
]
...
},
currentTabId: "fe::CustomTab::tab1",
refreshCause: "tabChanged" | "search" | "forcedRefresh"
}

methods.description: Method called when the content of a custom view used in a list report needs to be refreshed. This happens either when there is a change on the FilterBar and the search is triggered, or when a tab with custom content is selected, or when the view is forced to be refreshed through the Extension API for the list report's public method setTabContentToBeRefreshedOnNextOpening. This method can be overwritten by the controller extension in case of customization.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.templates.ListReport.ListReportController

symbols.name: sap.fe.templates.ObjectPage.ExtensionAPI
symbols.description:
Extension API for object pages on SAP Fiori elements for OData V4.
To correctly integrate your app extension coding with SAP Fiori elements, use only the extensionAPI of SAP Fiori elements. Don't access or manipulate controls, properties, models, or other internal objects created by the SAP Fiori elements framework.

methods.name: getBindingContext
methods.description: Gets the bound context of the current object page.

methods.name: getSelectedContexts

parameters.name: sTableId
parameters.description: The ID identifying the table the selected context is requested for

methods.description: Gets the list entries currently selected for the table.

methods.name: hideMessage
methods.description: Hides the message strip below the anchor bar.

methods.name: refresh

returnValue.description: Resolved once the data is refreshed or rejected if the request failed

parameters.name: vPath
parameters.description: Path or array of paths referring to entities or properties to be refreshed. If omitted, the whole object page is refreshed. The path "" refreshes the entity assigned to the object page without navigations

methods.description: Refreshes either the whole object page or only parts of it.

methods.name: setAsSectionTitleOwner

parameters.name: control
parameters.description: The single content control can be either one of the standard building blocks (Form, Chart, Table), or reuse components, or sap.m.Title.

methods.description: Defines a control to be the title owner of its section/subsection. As the title owners of standard subsections are determined automatically, it is recommended to use this function for custom section/subsection. The title owner can be either one of the standard building blocks (Form, Chart, Table), or reuse components, or sap.m.Title. The framework adapts the value of these properties to be aligned with the title that is shown in the anchor bar (or icon tab bar) for the section. Moreover, the title of the subsection (and if applicable also of the section) is hidden in order to prevent redundant titles, if the subsection possesses a title owner. Hint: If you choose to set sap.m.Title as the title owner, styling adjustments may be required in the custom view. For example, if sap.m.Title is set as title owner which belongs to sap.m.OverflowToolbar or to sap.m.Toolbar, then the ‘design’ property of the toolbar control is to be set to ‘Transparent’.

methods.name: showMessages
methods.description: Displays the message strip between the title and the header of the ObjectPage.

methods.name: showSideContent

parameters.name: sSubSectionKey
parameters.description: Key of the side content fragment as defined in the manifest.json

parameters.name: bShow
parameters.description: Optional Boolean flag to show or hide the side content

methods.description: Displays or hides the side content of an object page.

symbols.title: class sap.fe.templates.ObjectPage.ExtensionAPI
